title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 204.9 - Budget and assessment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 204.9 - Budget and assessment

State Regulations

During each marketing season and not later than July 1, the
commissioner shall estimate a budget that includes contributions and
assessments necessary for the administration and enforcement of this order and
for carrying on duly authorized programs and activities including marketing, and product research and informational services as hereinbefore provided. The
commissioner shall announce rates of assessment to provide adequate funds to
defray expenditures in the budget. The rate of assessment shall not exceed four
cents per hundred pounds of apples or 16 mils (.016) per bushel of apples sold
for processing, juice or fresh market use. The total amount of budgeted
administrative cost shall not exceed five percent of the total
budget. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
204.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
